section.title: Jitter Seal Mechanism
section.t: The jitter seal binds evidence packets to the physical timing characteristics of the authorship environment, creating a non-transferable proof of temporal authenticity.

section.title: Timing Capture
section.t: The Attester captures inter-keystroke timing intervals at microsecond resolution. These intervals exhibit natural jitter from human motor control that serves as a behavioral entropy source. The jitter seal is computed as:

section.title: Seal Verification
section.t: The Verifier checks the jitter seal by:

list.t: Reconstructing the timing vector from the evidence packet.
Verifying the HMAC using the Attester's public key.
Confirming that the VDF proof is valid for the stated T_difficulty parameter.
Checking that the timing entropy exceeds the minimum threshold for the claimed assurance tier.

section.title: Entropy Requirements
section.t: The minimum Shannon entropy for timing vectors is tier-dependent: T1 requires 2.0 bits/sample, T2 requires 3.0 bits/sample, T3 requires 3.5 bits/sample, and T4 requires 4.0 bits/sample. Vectors failing to meet the threshold MUST be flagged in the Attestation Result.
